Deficiency Narrative: An employees file is missing a A Pre-Employment Affidavit form.
Staff files are missing the summary of the reference check interviews.
Staffs files are missing documentation of a TB screening.
The agency has not submitted their EBI data for the 1st quarter of 2025.
Correction Narrative:
True Home of Hope staff members have compile and submit the missing EBI data by April 16, 2025.
Responsible staff will receive refresher training on EBI reporting requirements by a due date.
A monthly compliance checklist will be implemented by the destinated staff.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection it was found that medication counts were not accurate in 2 of the reviewed medication logs.
Correction Narrative: This standard was reviewed and found to be in compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: A child in care was prescribed medication that was not administered to the child.
Correction Narrative:
The operation currently does not have any children in care. The operations advised of the following as corrections: 
All staff received refresher training on medication administration policy on 7/22/2025, emphasizing the 5 Rights of medication (right child, right drug, right dose, right time, right route).
A daily end-of-shift medication must be implemented to ensure no prescribed medication is missed.
The supervisor must cross-reference physician orders with MAR logs for new orders and weekly.
The supervisor and case manager will ensure every dose is accounted for and documented within 2 hours of administration.
Any missed or skipped doses must be immediately escalated to the LCCA or Program Director and addressed according to the minimum standards.
Continued noncompliance will result in disciplinary action, up to and including suspension from direct care responsibilities.

Deficiency Narrative: Medication logs were reviewed to be incomplete and not updated timely.
Correction Narrative:
The operation currently does not have any children in care. The operations advised of the following as corrections: 
The Medication Administration Log (MAR) was updated to include a mandatory double-verification checkbox before each administration. 7/22/2025
Staff were re-educated on the requirement to document medication administration within 2 hours and ensure cumulative logs are complete and up to date.
Documentation of corrective action training will be placed in the personnel file.
Program Director will monitor audit results and initiate performance improvement plans for noncompliant staff.
Case Managers will review each childs medication record weekly to confirm that administration and documentation match the physicians order.
The facility will conduct quarterly policy reviews, which will be used to reinforce standards and address emerging gaps.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection it was found that medication counts were not accurate.
During the inspection it was observed that PM medications were being prepared in the AM hours by being removed from the package and placed in a container.
Correction Narrative: This standard was evaluated and found to be in compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, it was found that there was no record of administering 3 medications.
Correction Narrative: This standard was evaluated and found to be in compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: One employee's file did not have a completed notarized affidavit.
Correction Narrative: This standard was evaluated and found to be in compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: There are no personal towel, singleuse disposable towels, or hot air hand dryers in the upstairs bathroom.
Correction Narrative: Bathroom did have paper towels for hand washing.

Deficiency Narrative: There was no documentation provided for searches completed of the children's belonging by the staff.
Correction Narrative:
Searches will only be conducted when there is reasonable suspicion of contraband, safety concerns, or per the facility's routine search schedule.

All searches must be documented using the Resident Belongings Search Documentation Form and reviewed by a supervisor.

The least intrusive method of searching should always be used.

The child should be present during the search unless it is deemed unsafe.

Any items confiscated must be documented, stored securely, and handled according to facility procedures.

Deficiency Narrative: Upon moving out of the operation, staff refused to give a child's MP3 player and cell phone back due to the child and case worker not allowing staff to search her belongings.
Correction Narrative:
Children have the right to retain personal items unless those items pose a risk to safety.

Upon admission, an inventory of personal belongings will be taken and stored in the child's file.

If a child moves out of the facility, all belongings must be returned unless prohibited by law or caseworker directive.

Staff cannot withhold personal belongings as a form of discipline or due to refusal of a search.

Deficiency Narrative: The unauthorized log provided does not contain full record of all unauthorized absences of children in care.
Correction Narrative:
1.Documentation: 

All unauthorize absences will include the required components (duration of absence, intake report number, law enforcement agency name and report number, etc.).

A revised and comprehensive unauthorize absence log will be created, ensuring that all required fields are clearly defined and incorporated.

2.Training and Education for Staff:

All staff involved in documentation undergo training on the updated policy and procedure for maintaining unauthorized absence logs. This will include:
	-How to properly document the length of time a child is absent.
	-The importance of recording the intake report number for hotline incidents.
	-How to correctly record the law enforcement agencys name and report number when applicable.
	The requirement to allow all unauthorized absences, ensuring no incident- is omitted.

A staff member from the management team will be designated to review the log entries to ensure accuracy and compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: A staff file requested was not available for immediate review.
Correction Narrative: Files were available for review upon request.

Deficiency Narrative: The unauthorized absence log does not include all of the required components such as how long the child was gone fore, intake report number for the incidents that were reported to the hotline, or the name of LE agency & number of police report. In addition, it does not indicate all unauthorized absences that have occurred at the operation.
Correction Narrative:
The operation provided the following correction: A revised and comprehensive unauthorize absence log will be created, ensuring that all required fields are clearly defined and incorporated. All staff involved in documentation undergo training on the updated policy and procedure for maintaining unauthorized absence logs. A staff member from the management team will be designated to review the log entries to ensure accuracy and compliance.
A follow up was conducted by inspection (INSP ID: 4043477) and the unauthorized absence log was observed.

Deficiency Narrative: A staff member who was not fully trained was left alone at the operation with 3 children, 2 of which had a history of habitually running away from the operation and resulted in 2 of the children running away.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided the following correction: The facility will implement a policy that prohibits leaving any untrained or insufficiently trained staff member alone with children, especially in situations involving children with known safety risks, such as running away. A review of all staff qualifications and training will be conducted to ensure that every staff member is fully trained in child supervision and emergency response before they are left alone with children. A follow up was conducted by inspection (INSP ID: 4043477) and the training rosters were observed.

Deficiency Narrative: Not all of the debriefings were completed or documented that an attempt was made.
Correction Narrative: The facility created a debriefing form which will be used after all significant incidents. Ttraining curriculum was observed to include the topic of conducting a debriefing after a child has an unauthorized absence.

Deficiency Narrative: Notifications are not being made to the caseworkers when a child over the age of 13 has been on an unauthorized absence longer than 6 hours.
Correction Narrative: The operation submitted the following correction: The facility will implement notifying caseworkers or parents within the required timeframe when a child over the age of 13 has been absent/Serious Incident-Report for more than 6 hours without authorization.	All relevant staff members will receive training on the updated procedure for managing unauthorized absences or Serious Incident-Report and the importance of timely notifications to caseworkers or parents. A follow up was conducted by inspection (INSP ID: 4043477) and the training curriculum was observed.

Deficiency Narrative: The serious incident was documented but was missing information, such as name of operation, physical address, telephone number.  Also missing is the child's name, age, gender, and date of admission of the child.
Correction Narrative: Email received on 1/21/2025 from operation stating that their Serious Incident Report form has been updated to reflect the current requirements of minimum standards. Training was conducted for all staff to ensure they understand the updated SIR form and its proper use.  Training covers the purpose of the form, how to accurately complete it and the reporting timeline.

Deficiency Narrative: Both fire extingushers have not been serviced for this year.
Correction Narrative: This standard was evaluated and found to be in compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: The upstairs fire extinguisher was behind a locked closet.  This was corrected at inspection.
The childs preliminary service plan does not address their supervision needs.
Correction Narrative: On 8/24/2024, Executive Director emailed the compliance plan. As a result, True Home of Hope Inc will ensure comprehensive assessments for child placement and ongoing evaluations. Responsibilities include organizing medical and psychological appointments, issuing monthly reports, and managing admission and discharge summaries. Additionally, develop service plans tailored to address the child's supervision and treatment needs. All team members are required to review and sign the Initial Service Plan within 15 days. The Program Administrator is responsible for enforcing all minimum standards consistently and ensuring the availability of all reports and records for Licensing staff review.

Deficiency Narrative: Several of the employees' files and children files were missing current trainings and required documents.
Correction Narrative: True Home of Hope will implement steps to ensure that all employees and children files are up to date with the required training, documents, printed out certificates for all employees, helping to maintain compliance In accordance with minimal standard.

Deficiency Narrative: During a review of documentation, the operation had no record of routine fire drills.
Correction Narrative:
True Home of Hope will schedule an emergency meeting to address the importance of fire drill records and discuss the importance of emergency preparedness. Will initiate an immediate review of existing emergency response according to the minimal standard to identify any other deficiencies.
True home of hope will establish a schedule for regular severe weather drills to be conducted Monthly and quarterly, with a drill that was scheduled on 05/05/2024.
A clearly define the type of severe weather scenarios to be simulated during drills (e.g., tornado, hurricane).
A specify length of time allocated for evacuation or relocation procedures during drills, ensuring realistic and achievable targets.
The designate evacuation routes and assembly points for everyone to gather safely following evacuation.
Appointing trained personnel to oversee the execution of drills and ensure compliance with minimal standards.
Document the date, time, type of drill, and outcomes of each severe weather drill for future reference and evaluation.
Training and Awareness:
True home of Hope will provide comprehensive training sessions for everyone on severe weather preparedness, including evacuation procedures and the importance of compliance during drills.

Deficiency Narrative: During a review of documentation, the operation was unable to provide an updated insurance card as for it expired on 4/23/2024.
Correction Narrative: True Home of Hope will follow a structured approach to make sure that the car insurance card is updated and available and establish procedures to maintain compliance according to minimal standard

To prevent contact with unauthorized children/people, she would step in momentarily to screen the call and leave immediately after. Picture of phone policy uploaded to document library. However, the staff was redirected to use more vague language when addressing the children about their inappropriate activities, to prevent children from being exposed to staff using said language.

Deficiency Narrative: A child's initial service plan was not followed specifically the child's supervision needs. In addition, the service plan was not signed by all required parties.
Correction Narrative: True Home of Hope Treatment Director must ensure comprehensive assessments for child placement and ongoing evaluations. Responsibilities include organizing medical and psychological appointments, issuing monthly reports, and managing admission and discharge summaries. Additionally, develop service plans tailored to address the child's supervision and treatment needs. All team members are required to review and sign the Initial Service Plan within 15 days. The Program Administrator is responsible for enforcing all minimum standards consistently and ensuring the availability of all reports and records for Licensing staff review. The Director confirmed that her treatment team are aware of their responsibilities concerning service plans.

Deficiency Narrative: All unauthorized absences are not being documented as required.
Correction Narrative: True Home of Hope caregivers must document unauthorized absences in an annual summary log, adhering to minimum standards. Details should include the duration of the absence or whether the child failed to return. In the event of three unauthorized absences within a 60-day period, a triggered review of the childs unauthorized absences is required, aligning with minimum standards. Furthermore, the organization must conduct an operational evaluation for unauthorized absences every six months as required. Annual summary logs must be readily available for review by Licensing upon request. The Director confirmed that the log was created, the staff was made aware of the requirements to document unauthorized absences in a timely fashion.

Deficiency Narrative: The EBI documentation was only documented but not reviewed by anyone.
Correction Narrative: True Home of Hope Program Administrator is responsible for ensuring that all caregivers involved in EBI (Emergency Behavior Intervention) adhere to minimum standards. This includes promptly conducting a review of interventions within 72 hours of an incident and signing off on documents. Compliance with these standards is essential for maintaining the safety and well-being of the children under care. The Director confirmed that the administrator was made aware of the responsibility to review EBI documentation.

Deficiency Narrative: The annual summary log provided did not meet the criteria to be the unauthorized absence summary log as it did not contain any of the necessary information required by the minimum standards.
Correction Narrative: True Home of Hope caregivers must document unauthorized absences in an annual summary log, adhering to minimum standards. Details should include the duration of the absence or whether the child failed to return. In the event of three unauthorized absences within a 60-day period, a triggered review of the childs unauthorized absences is required, aligning with minimum standards. Furthermore, the organization must conduct an operational evaluation for unauthorized absences every six months as required. Annual summary logs must be readily available for review by Licensing upon request. The Director was able to present a revised copy of the unauthorized absence log including the necessary information.
